name: Visitor Visa: Tourism or Business
description: You are traveling to Mexico for tourism

name: Visa (Lucrative) for visitors with work permit authorization for lucrative activities
description: If you have an authorization by the National Immigration Institute (Instituto Nacional de Migración) to apply for a work-related visa; or if you are visiting Mexico to perform a professional activity and you will receive a payment in Mexico.

name: Temporary Resident Visa
description: You want to live in Mexico for more than 180 days and less than 4 years

name: Temporary Resident Visa for Students
description:
You are traveling to study in Mexico.
You receive a scholarship from the Mexican Government.
You do not have a work authorization.

name: Permanent Resident Visa
description: You are retired and have the social security statement

name: Study Permit
description: Authorizes foreign nationals to study at a designated learning institution in Canada.

name: Rural and Northern Immigration Pilot (RNIP)
description: Community-driven PR pathway for skilled workers in participating rural/northern communities.

name: Protected Person / Asylum (In-Canada claim)
description: Complex process; may be ineligible if safe third country applies at POE.

name: Atlantic Immigration Program (AIP)
description: Employer-driven program for skilled workers and international graduates in Atlantic provinces.

name: Provincial Entrepreneur/Investor Streams
description: Entrepreneur/investor pathways run by provinces leading to nomination and PR.

name: Student Direct Stream (SDS) - Study Permit
description: Faster processing for eligible students from specific countries meeting additional criteria.

name: Express Entry - Canadian Experience Class (CEC)
description: For applicants with Canadian skilled work experience.

name: Express Entry - Federal Skilled Trades (FST)
description: For qualified skilled tradespeople meeting eligibility and job offer/certification.

name: Self-employed Persons Program (Cultural/Athletes)
description: For self-employed individuals with relevant cultural or athletic experience who will make a significant contribution.

name: Quebec-selected skilled workers (QSW)
description: For workers selected by Quebec; two-step process (CSQ then PR).

name: Resettled Refugees (GAR/PSR/JAS)
description: Government-Assisted Refugees, Privately Sponsored Refugees, and Joint Assistance Sponsorship programs for overseas refugees.

name: Schengen Visas
description: The Schengen visa is issued to nationals listed in Annex I of Regulation (EU) 2018 1806. It opens in new window. This visa allows the holder to stay in the Schengen area for up to 90 days (in any 180-day period) for the purposes of tourism, business, visiting family, medical treatment, studies, training placements or volunteer activities that last under 3 months, or for other non-gainful activities. It also allows transit through the territory and airports.

name: Remote Work (No dedicated digital nomad visa)
description: Canada has no dedicated digital nomad visa; remote work typically requires status consistent with visitor rules.

name: Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA)
description: Required for visa-exempt nationals entering Canada by air. Linked electronically to passport.

name: Transit Visa
description: Required for certain nationals transiting through Canada for under 48 hours.

name: Digital Nomad Visa
description: The Digital Nomad Visa allows remote workers to live legally in Estonia for up to 12 months while working for foreign companies or clients.

name: D Visa
description: Typically applied for alongside the residence permit and is available for those coming to work, study, or for family reasons

name: Work Visa
description: Applicants may apply for a study visa if they intend to study, scholarships or participate in internships in official, governmental or exchange programs in institutions accredited or authorized by the corresponding official bodies.

name: Humanitarian and emergency visa
description: Those who have a well-founded and duly accredited reason for entering Uruguay may apply for the humanitarian and emergency visa, such as: medical treatment, attendance at a court hearing, death or health situation of a family member or friend and, cases authorized by the competent authority.

name: Student Visa
description: Study Visa

name: Research, Teaching or Academic Extension Visa
description: Academic research, Teaching or Extension (VITEM I)

name: Health Treatment Visa
description: Health Treatment Visa

name: Visitor Visa (Temporary Resident Visa, TRV)
description: Allows temporary entry for tourism, family visits, or business visitor activities.

name: Business Visitor (TRV or eTA)
description: Permits business visitor activities (meetings, conferences) without a work permit.

name: Super Visa (Parents and Grandparents)
description: Allows parents/grandparents of Canadian citizens or permanent residents to visit for extended periods.

name: Residence Permit
description: For researchers and academics hosted by a Finnish institution.

name: ICT Residence Permit
description: For intra-corporate transferees (specialists or managers)

name: Study Permit
description: Students who plan to study for longer than 3 months must apply for a study permit. You must be accepted to full-time study, have a minimum of NOK 166, 859 (~ $16, 860 USD) annually to live on, and may work up to 20 hours part-time while enrolled.

name: Study Visa
description: Applicants may apply for a study visa if they intend to study, scholarships or participate in internships in official, governmental or exchange programs in institutions accredited or authorized by the corresponding official bodies.

name: Tourist Visa
description: Those who wish to enter Uruguay on a temporary basis for pleasure or for a break will have to apply for a tourism visa

name: Visa for congresses, conventions and seminars on a national or international level
description: Those who wish to enter Uruguay who can provide an invitation from the organizers of the event on a national or international of public interest that take place in Uruguay will have to apply for a work visa.

name: Study Permit
description: Student

name: Study Permit
description: Student (Private secondary institution)

official_link:
Basic information -  https://www.irishimmigration.ie/registering-your-immigration-permission/ 
All queries MUST be processed through https://portal.irishimmigration.ie/en/  It's important to book your registration appointment as soon as possible after you arrive. As soon as you arrive in Ireland, you should create an account on the Customer Service Portal and book an appointment.

Appointment slots are released on a rolling 90 day basis. Please be aware that given the current high demand, appointment slots do fill up quickly. When possible, additional appointments are released. You can amend the date of your appointment to any other available date at any time via the reschedule option.

If an appointment is not available within 90 days of your arrival, please do not worry. Once you have successfully booked an appointment within the 90 days of arrival, this will be sufficient to remain in the state until the date of your appointment. You should however book your appointment as soon as you arrive in the State.

Note: If you are a visa-required national and you leave the state prior to your registration appointment, you will not be able to re-enter the state without a new entry visa.

name: Volunteer Permit
description:
If you would like to volunteer in Ireland you may do so with an eligible organisation for up to 2 years, with the possibility of a third year, subject to the conditions below.

This scheme applies to both visa required and non-visa required nationals. You must apply before you travel to Ireland. Do not apply under this scheme if your intended stay in Ireland is for less than 3 months.

The immigration permission and application system described on this page is based on the Immigration policy for Volunteering in Ireland published 30 April, 2018 (updated June 2023). The Department of Justice reserves the right to amend or suspend this policy at any time. The information below is intended as a guide only, the policy document Volunteering in Ireland outlines all of the relevant criteria for eligibility for this programme.
What does this Scheme allow me to do?

Permission to remain in Ireland as a volunteer allows you to work in Ireland in a volunteering role with an eligible organisation for up to 2 years (with an option to extend for a third year), subject to the conditions below:

    Work in a volunteering role with an eligible organisation

    Your role must match the criteria for volunteering described below

    The organisation must match the criteria for eligibility described below

    Stay in Ireland for 1 year initially, up to 2 years (with an option to apply for an extension for a third year)

    Apply to change the organisation you volunteer for once in any 12 month period

    Travel abroad for short periods (for example holidays and attending conferences) and return to Ireland.

The initial permitted period of residence under this Scheme is 1 year (12 months) and the maximum is 2 years (24 months). You may, for example, spend 24 consecutive months in the State or break the period into two separate lots of 12 months each, separated by time.

name: Marriage visa
description: To visit Ireland for the purpose of being married

name: Study Permit
description: Typically requires an invitation or affiliation with a Norwegian research institution, some exceptions apply for self-funded projects.

name: Visit & Holiday
description: No visa, 90 day visitor window

name: Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)
description: Meet specific provincial criteria; obtain nomination.

name: Express Entry - Federal Skilled Worker (FSW)
description: Minimum eligibility (education, language, funds) and CRS ranking.

name: Significant Benefit to Canada (R205a)
description: LMIA-exempt for applicants whose work would bring significant social/cultural/economic benefit to Canada.

name: Temporary Resident Permit (TRP)
description: Allows inadmissible persons to enter/stay temporarily when justified by compelling reasons.

name: International Experience Canada (IEC) - International Co-op (Internship)
description: Employer-specific work permit for students to gain work experience related to studies.

name: International Experience Canada (IEC) - Working Holiday
description: Open work permit for youth from partner countries to travel and work in Canada.

name: International Experience Canada (IEC) - Young Professionals
description: Employer-specific work permit for gaining professional work experience.

name: Seasonal Agricultural Worker Program (SAWP)
description: Employer-specific permits for seasonal agricultural workers from designated countries.

name: Employer-specific Work Permit (LMIA-based)
description: Employer-specific work permit based on positive LMIA under TFWP.

name: Open Work Permit (various)
description: Open work permits allow work for any employer (with some exceptions).

name: Intra-Company Transferee (ICT)
description: LMIA-exempt employer-specific permit for multinational transfers (executives, managers, specialized knowledge).

name: CUSMA Professionals (formerly NAFTA)
description: LMIA-exempt permits for eligible U.S. and Mexican professionals under CUSMA.

name: Agricultural Stream (non-SAWP)
description: Employer-specific permits for agriculture outside SAWP for wider nationalities.

name: Family Sponsorship - Dependent Child
description: Child meets dependency definition; sponsor eligibility.

name: Start-up Visa Program
description: Letter of support from designated org; language/funds.

name: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) PR
description: Strong H&C grounds; inadmissibility or ineligibility under other streams.

name: Family Sponsorship - Parents and Grandparents (PGP)
description: Sponsor meets income requirements; invited to apply.

name: Agri-Food Pilot
description: Canadian work experience in eligible occupations; job offer.

name: Family Sponsorship - Spouse/Common-law/Conjugal Partner
description: Sponsor eligibility; genuine relationship; admissibility.

name: Quebec Experience Program (PEQ)
description: Meet PEQ criteria (work experience or Quebec study).

name: Telework (Digital Nomad) Visa
description: This visa is intended for foreigners who travel to Spain to carry out a remote work or professional activity for companies located outside the national territory, through the exclusive use of computer, telematics and telecommunication media and systems.

name: ESA Visa
description: This visa is intended for professionals in the audiovisual sector, understanding as such foreign artists, technicians and professionals who are going to carry out activities within the audiovisual sector and artistic activities facing the public or intended to record of any kind for broadcast by mass media, for a duration between 91 and 180 days.

name: Visa for Highly Qualified Workers and Intra-Company Transfers
description:
Visa for highly qualified workers: Visa to carry out a work activity as an employee in Spain as a highly qualified professional, member of senior management personnel meeting certain criteria set forth in prevailing legislation, or as a graduate or post-graduate of a prestigious university and/or business school. 

Visa for intra-company transfers: Visa to carry out a work activity as an employee in Spain as a member of senior management personnel, a specialist or a trainee, to perform a contract, or in regards to a professional relationship, when the transfer is made within the same company or group of companies.

name: Study Visa
description: Visa for stays longer than 90 days to pursue higher education, post-compulsory secondary education, student mobility programs, volunteer services, or training activities that entitles to apply for a study visa.

name: Study visa for NALCAP
description: Visa for stays exceeding 90 days to participate in the North American Language and Culture Assistant program (NALCAP) sponsored by the Ministry of Education of Spain.

name: Study visa for minors
description: Visa for stays longer than 90 days to pursue higher education, post-compulsory secondary education, student mobility programs, volunteer services, or training activities that entitles to apply for a study visa.

name: Specific procedure for Student visas for Au-Pairs
description: The immigration regulation RD1155/2024, in force since May 20, 2025, no longer refers to study visas for au-pairs. However, it is possible that an au-pair apply for a study visa, for example, for Spanish language studies, with a minimum of 20 hours per week

name: Entrepreneur Visa
description: Visa for foreigners moving to Spain to carry out the procedures necessary to undertake an innovative, entrepreneurial activity of particular economic interest for Spain.

name: RSA Visa
description: This visa is intended for professionals in the audiovisual sector, understanding as such foreign artists, technicians and professionals who are going to carry out activities within the audiovisual sector and artistic activities facing the public or intended to record of any kind for broadcast by mass media, for a duration of more than 180 days.

name: Researcher Visa
description:
Visa to engage in training, research, development and innovation activities at public or private entities in the following cases: 

Research staff referred ​to in article 13 and additional provision one of Act 14/2011 of 1 June on Science, Technology and Innovation.
Scientific and technical staff carrying out scientific research, development and technological innovation work at business entities or R&D&i centres established in Spain.
Researchers hosted, in the framework of an agreement, by public or private research bodies.
Teaching staff hired by universities, higher education and research bodies or centres, or business schools established in Spain.

name: Visa for Family members of a citizen of the European Union
description: Direct family members of citizens of the European Union or of the States of the European Economic Area (EEA) or Switzerland are entitled to a preferential free-of-charge visa, provided that they are travelling with the EU/EEA/CH citizen of the European Union, the EEA or Switzerland or are on the way to joining them.

name: Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP)
description: Open work permit for graduates of eligible programs at DLIs, length depends on study length.

name: Family Reunification Visa
description: Children of a Brazilian Citizen or Permanent Resident in Brazil

name: Bridging Open Work Permit (BOWP)
description: Open work permit for eligible applicants who have applied for PR and await a decision.

name: Start-Up Visa
description:
Temporary residence permit (TRP) for business as a startup
Why? Once the business is registered in Estonia, you can apply for the TRP for business. It allows one to reside in Estonia for up to 5 years (the Police Board will decide the length of the permit). With TRP, you will also get the Estonian identification code. If you need it before, apply for one at the International House of Estonia.
Where to apply? If you are already in Estonia, you can apply at the Police Board. If abroad, you can submit the application at the Estonian embassy handling the TRP applications. 
How to apply? Book an appointment at the Police Board or at the Estonian embassy for the residence permit process.
Documents needed? Can be found here. Add proof of funds, health insurance coverage, and a cover letter explaining your business in Estonia. Process up to 2 months. 
Family members TRP? Founders can sponsor close family member permits (add proof of family ties, and insurance).
Keep this in mind! Submitting documents doesn’t give you legal grounds to stay in Estonia. You are allowed to work, but your main purpose should be working on your startup. Exempt from the annual immigration quota.

name: Employment Residence Permits
description: A residence permit for employment is a temporary residence permit issued by the Estonian Police and Border Guard Board for employment in Estonia. Upon being granted a residence permit, you shall be issued a residence card. A residence card is a document proving your right of residence in Estonia, which also serves as your identity card. The residence card contains your personal details, residence permit details, photo and fingerprint images

name: Residence Permit
description: For students pursuing higher education (A permit) or other studies (B permit)

name: Residence Permit
description: For those coming to Finland to work, including specialists, start-up entrepreneurs, and those in management positions

name: Residence Permit
description: For startup founders, employees, and investors in the tech sector.

name: Schengen Visa
description: Stay up to 90 days in Schengen for tourism, business, or transit.

name: Residence Permit
description: For family members of Finnish residents or those with other residence permits

name: Employment Permit
description: To work in Ireland based on an employment permit

name: D8 Visa (Digital Nomad Visa)
description: designed for remote workers and freelancers who earn income from outside Portugal.

name: D2 Visa (Entrepreneur / Startup Visa)
description: for those starting or investing in a business in Portugal

name: D7 Visa (Passive Income / Retirement Visa)
description: retirees, remote workers, and those with stable passive income (pensions, rental income, dividends, etc.).

name: Golden Visa (Investment Visa)
description: requires a qualifying investment in Portugal (real estate, funds, or business, though rules have tightened in recent years).

name: Business Visa
description: Those who wish to enter Uruguay to carry out business activities or for the purpose of investment or commercial exchange with Uruguayan companies or with headquarters in Uruguay or public organizations will have to apply for a business visa.

name: Family reunification visa
description: Family reunification visas may be applied to by persons who wish to be reunited with their family members in accordance with article 10 of Law Number 18,250 of 6 2008. Reunification may be requested by parents, spouses, minor unmarried children or adults with disabilities. This process may be carried out with a family member who is a permanent resident or who is in the process of becoming a resident

name: International Protection
description: Application for International Protection (claiming asylum or refugee status)

name: International Protection
description: Reunification of families seeking asylum

name: Residence Permit
description: To retire to or live in Ireland as a person of independent means (If you have been issued with a letter from the Minister for Justice granting you permission to reside in Ireland as a person of independent means you are required to register that permission.),  To be a visiting academic at an Irish University or College (If you have been issued with a letter from the Minister for Justice – Atypical scheme – granting you permission to work as a visiting academic in Ireland for more than 90 days you are required to register that permission.), OR To live in Ireland as the elderly dependent relative of a non- EU/EEA or Swiss citizen

name: Employment Permit
description: You are the spouse/de facto partner of a critical skills employment permit holder, an NCHD multi-site general employment permit holder, a researcher on a hosting agreement a general employment or reactivation permit holder, or an intra-company transferee permit holder   OR   you are a person who qualifies for the Third Level Graduate Programme and are moving from a Stamp 2 to a Stamp 1G    OR  a person who qualifies for the 24- month Third Level Graduate Programme; you have received the initial 12 months and are renewing for the further 12 months.

name: Employment Permit
description: To work in Ireland as an NCHD based on a multi-site general employment permit.

name: Residence Permit
description: As you are a dependent, other than a spouse/de facto partner, of a critical skills employment permit holder, an NCHD multi-site general employment permit holder, or a researcher on a hosting agreement a general employment or reactivation permit holder, or an intra-company transferee permit holder.   OR   As a volunteer   OR   As a minister of religion  OR  Based on a letter from Department of Justice or Immigration Service Delivery.

name: Employment Permit
description: As you have been registered on a Stamp 1 permission on the basis of a Critical Skills Employment Permit and/or Hosting Agreement for a minimum of 21 months, or a General Employment Permit for a minimum of 57 months   OR  As you have been registered on a Stamp 1H permission on the basis of a Multi-Site General Employment Permit for a minimum of 21 months  OR  As you live with your spouse/ civil partner who is an Irish citizen  OR   you previously had a Stamp 1G as spouse/ civil partner/ de facto partner of a Critical Skills Employment Permit holder for 5 years and are now seeking a Stamp 4   OR  you are the parent of a child who is an Irish citizen   OR  you have been granted permission by the Repatriation Unit in Immigration Service Delivery, under section 3 of the Immigration Act 1999  OR  you live with your long term, de facto partner who is an Irish citizen  OR  you live with and are the dependant of a family member (not listed in this table) who is an Irish citizen  OR   you are a recognised refugee  OR  you have Subsidiary Protection   OR   you have Permission to Remain (formally called Leave to Remain) status   OR   you are in Ireland through Family Reunification with a family member who has been granted Refugee Status or Subsidiary Protection   OR   You are an entrepreneur   OR   You are an investor in a business    OR   You previously had a Stamp 4S and are changing to or renewing a Stamp 4   OR   you have been granted permission under the Long term Undocumented Migrants Scheme

name: Residence Card of a Family Member of a Union Citizen' (also referred to as an EU Treaty Rights application).
description: As you are the qualifying or recognised permitted family member of EU/EEA or Swiss citizen in Ireland   OR   you are the qualifying or recognised permitted Parent of EU/EEA or Swiss citizen Child in Ireland.

name: Common Travel Agreement
description: Registration for Permanent Residence of UK Nationals under the Common Travel Area

name: Common Travel Agreement
description: Registration for Permanent Residence of UK National spouse under the Common Travel Area

name: Caregivers: Home Child Care Provider Pilot (HCCP)
description: Caregiver pilot allowing work with pathway to PR after qualifying work experience.

name: Caregivers: Home Support Worker Pilot (HSWP)
description: Caregiver pilot allowing work with pathway to PR after qualifying work experience.

name: Visa for Airport Transit
description: Specifically given to foreign nationals and permits them to stay in the international circulation zone of an Albanian airport for a certain amount of time, depending on their itinerary for their flight.

name: Visa for Tourism
description: This visa allows travellers to visit Albania for tourism purposes, including leisure, sightseeing, and family visits, for a short stay

name: Visa for Scientific, Cultural, Sports and Humanitarian Reasons
description: This visa is designed for individuals travelling to Albania for scientific research, cultural exchanges, sports events, or humanitarian work.

name: Visa for Official Business
description: This visa is intended for government officials or individuals visiting Albania for official purposes, such as meetings or diplomatic events.

name: Visa for Medical Reasons
description: This visa is granted to individuals seeking medical treatment in Albania for a short duration, including consultations and procedures.

name: Visa for Professional, Commercial and Business Purposes
description: Allows for stays of up to 90 days within a 180-day period and can be used for attending meetings, conferences, and business activities

name: Tourism and Transit
description: Schengen Tourist and Transit Visa

name: Business
description: Schengen Business Visa

name: Visitor Visa: Tourism or Business
description: You are traveling to Mexico for tourism, transit, business, technical, artistic, sports, journalist or correspondent activities; and minister or religious associate. You will be in Mexico for a stay no longer than 180 days. You do not have an offer or authorization of employment.

name: Permanent Resident Visa
description: You are retired and have the social security statement, you are moving to Mexico definitely, you do not have work authorization

name: Visa for Study Purposes
description: For study purposes allows students to enter Albania for educational programs lasting longer than 90 days

name: Visa for Research
description: Those working on academic or scientific projects in Albania are granted this visa. It encourages researchers to work with institutions in Albania.

name: Visa for Vocational Training
description: This visa is designed for people enrolled in Albanian vocational training programs. Its main goal is to support professional growth and skill acquisition in particular crafts or sectors

name: Visa for Self-Employed People
description: This visa supports those intending to start or run their businesses in Albania. Its goal is to promote economic expansion and entrepreneurship

name: Visa for humanitarian or religious activities
description: Designed for individuals to engage in humanitarian or religious work, such as volunteering, missionary work, or humanitarian aid

name: Family Reunion Visa
description: Allows non-EU citizens who have family members residing in Albania to join them for an extended period of time

name: Diplomatic visa or visa service
description: Allows foreign nationals to enter Albania for diplomatic purposes, such as working for a foreign embassy or consulate

name: Visa for seasonal employment purposes
description: This visa is intended for people in seasonal occupations, including hospitality, tourism, or agriculture. Its objective is to meet Albania's seasonal demand for temporary labour.

name: Visa for unpaid trainee
description: This visa allows people to participate in unpaid training programs in Albania. Through internships or real-world experiences, it aims to assist in skill development or satisfy academic requirements.

name: Visa for au pairs
description: This visa is designed for young people who work as au pairs to help host families with childcare and housework while learning about Albanian customs.

name: Visa for youth exchanges
description: This visa is intended to promote youth exchange programs between Albania and other nations, promoting cooperation and cross-cultural understanding

name: Visa as an Employee
description: This visa is intended for people who have long-term work agreements in Albania. It makes it easier to find employment in several Albanian economic sectors

name: Visa for In-House Transferees
description: This visa is for personnel transferred by their employer to work in Albania. It enables corporations to relocate personnel from other nations to their Albanian offices

name: Visa for Athletes
description: Professional athletes participating in tournaments, training sessions, or sporting events in Albania are the target audience for this visa

name: Visa for Voluntary Service
description: This visa is intended for volunteers in Albania. Its goal is to use volunteerism to advance social and communal development

name: Visa for Highly Qualified Employees
description: Professionals with advanced degrees or specialised skills who support Albania's economic growth are the target of this visa

name: Visa for Digital Mobile Workers
description: This visa makes it easier for digital nomads or remote workers to live in Albania while working for international businesses. Its goal is to attract global talent seeking flexible employment arrangements

name: Visa for Investors
description: This visa targets foreign investors who wish to contribute to Albania's economy. Its goal is to attract foreign investment and encourage domestic economic endeavours

name: Visa for Contracting Services
description: Professionals are permitted to provide contract-based services in Albania with this visa. It is frequently employed for short-term or project-specific tasks

name: Visa for Crew of Vessels
description: Specifically allows crew members of foreign vessels to enter and stay in Albania for an extended period, often for the purpose of securing a residence permit.

name: Visa for Use of Owned Immovable Property
description: Real estate owners in Albania who want to remain in the country for a long time

name: Visa for Pensioners (Retired)
description: This visa is intended for retirees who plan to relocate to Albania. Its goal is to provide seniors a quiet, reasonably priced place to live

name: Digital Nomad Visa
description: "Introduced in 2022, the Digital Nomad Visa allows foreign nationals to live in Brazil while working remotely for companies based abroad. This visa caters to individuals who can demonstrate employment or income independent of Brazilian employers.  Brazil’s Federal Government enacted this visa under Normative Resolution No. 45 of the National Immigration Council, offering remote workers the chance to stay legally for an extended period."

name: Visitor Visa (e-visa)
description: Visitor Visa

name: Retirement Visa
description: A Permanent  Visa may be granted to the retired foreign citizens wishing to live in Brazil, provided that they are already in use of their pension, and legally allowed to transfer to Brazil a regular monthly income in a foreign currency, pension included, equivalent to a minimum of R$ 6.000,00 (six thousand reais). This minimum required income will allow for the applicant to take two legal dependents to Brazil. For every additional dependent, an additional amount of R$ 2.000,00 (two thousand reais) per month will be required. Applicants must lodge their application in person (not required for the dependents).   The procedure of applying for this visa requires an approval from our Ministry of External Relations, which takes approximately 8 weeks.  Only after the receipt of this approval can the visa be issued. Once approved, visa must be issued within 6 months. Within 30 days of arrival in Brazil, bearers of these types of visas must register with the Brazilian Immigration authorities (The Federal Police Department-DPMAF) and submit a copy of the visa application form, provided to them by this Embassy upon collection of the visa.

name: Investment Visa
description: Foreign citizens that wish to establish temporary residence in Brazil as follows:  Intra-company transferee to represent commercial or civil corporation, group or economic conglomerate as administrator, manager, director or executive with management powers;  Foreigners investing in a Brazilian company. Eligible dependents of a VITEM IX holder or applicant may apply for a Temporary Visa XI - Family Reunion.

name: WCATT
description:
To remain in Ireland 'Without condition as to time' (WCATT).
Registration granted to persons in receipt of a letter from the Minister for Justice is granted for the duration specified in the letter and thereafter the permission may be renewed subject to the conditions provided for in the letter of permission issued by the Minister.

name: Study
description: Study

name: Independent Work
description: This type of visa is specifically conceived for professionals who intend to perform self-employment activities for regulated or unregulated professions in Italy

name: Subordinate Work
description: The subordinate (dependent) work visa allows entry and long stay in Italy for skilled migrants holding an employment contract and sponsored by an employer. This type of visa may only be issued upon authorization from the relevant Sportello Unico dell'Immigrazione (SUI) in Italy.

name: Elective Residency
description: This visa is issued solely to those applicants who are planning to move permanently to Italy and it does not allow the recipient to work. This consular administration has full authority to evaluate and request additional documentation, if deemed necessary, in addition to what is submitted.

name: Religious Activity
description: The entry visa for religious reasons allows entry, for a short or long-stay, to foreign religious persons, meaning those who have already received priestly ordination, or equivalent status, religious, ministers of cults belinging to confessional orgranisations registered on the list kept by the Ministry of the Interior, who intend to participate in religious events or to carry out ecclesiastical, religious or pastoral activities.

name: Family Reasons
description: The family reasons visa allows entrance in Italy to:  a relative(spouse, children, or dependent parents)of a non-EU citizen holding a regular Italian Permit of stay.

name: Temporary Resident Visa for Students
description: You are traveling to study in Mexico. You receive a scholarship from the Mexican Government. You do not have a work authorization.

name: Temporary Resident Visa
description: You want to live in Mexico for more than 180 days and less than 4 years, AND you are not planning to be employed in Mexico.

name: Digital Nomad
description: Short term option for solo professionals and families with remote work flexibility.

name: Tourist
description: American and Canadian tourists can typically stay 90 to 180 days, reset by exiting and reentering the country.

name: Pensionado
description: For retirees or other individuals with a life-time fixed income source.

name: Rentista
description: For individuals with sufficient funds in a bank account in their home country or a stable income meeting a minimum monthly threshold.

name: Inversionista
description: For those able to invest a set amount in the country

name: VLS-TS long-stay visa – Student
description: Study or internship >3 months; visa acts as residence permit.

name: Talent Passport – Researcher
description: For researchers and academics hosted by a French institution.

name: Internship Visa (VLS-TS Stagiaire)
description: For students undertaking an internship in France as part of their studies.

name: Talent Passport – Business Creator
description: For founders establishing or investing in a business in France.

name: French Tech Visa (Talent Passport)
description: Fast-track Talent Passport for startup founders, employees, and investors in the tech sector.

name: Uniform Schengen visa (short-stay C)
description: Stay up to 90 days in Schengen for tourism, business, or transit.

name: VLS-TS – Visitor
description: Non-working stay up to 6 months/year; not eligible for residence.

name: Working Holiday visa (PVT)
description: Bilateral WH visa for youth to work & travel in France.

name: Talent Passport – Qualified Employee
description: Long-stay visa for highly qualified workers with job offers in France.

name: Talent Passport – Artistic/Cultural
description: For artists or cultural professionals recognised in their field.

name: Job-Seeker/New Business Visa
description: For foreign graduates of French universities seeking work or starting a business.

name: Au Pair Visa
description: For young foreigners to live with a French host family and assist with childcare.

name: Family Reunification Visa
description: Allows family members to join foreign nationals residing in France.

name: Intra-Company Transfer (ICT)
description: For employees transferred to a French branch of their company.

name: EU Blue Card
description: For highly qualified non-EU professionals under the EU Blue Card scheme.

name: Volunteer Visa (Service Civique)
description: For volunteering in approved civic service programs in France.

name: Seasonal Work Visa
description: For temporary employment in agriculture, tourism, or hospitality.

name: Employment Permit
description: To work in Ireland as a trainee accountant.

name: Unrestricted Permission
description: Issued to persons granted permission without conditions, ie recognised dual citizens. Applications processed by Unit 3 and stamp placed in non-EEA Passport by Unit 3. No need for Registration or Renewal.

name: Citizenship
description:
Every country has its own laws and rules about becoming a citizen. Ireland is no different. So, how do you become an Irish citizen by naturalisation? There are three main ways you can apply for Irish citizenship by naturalisation:

    1 You have legally lived in Ireland for five years
    2 You are married to or in a civil partnership with an Irish citizen
    3 You are applying on behalf of a minor.

If you are in Ireland as a refugee, you can also become an Irish citizen after three years. We have a system in place to help you through the citizenship process.

Each pathway to citizenship has its own specific requirements, which are explained below. However, generally you must:

    Have the correct identity documents to prove who you are
    Have the correct residency documents to prove that you have legally lived in Ireland for the correct number of years
    Reach the correct total score on the citizenship scorecard system.

All citizenship applications are processed by the Citizenship Division in Immigration Service Delivery (ISD).

name: Family of US Military Personnel
description: This visa is for US military personnel and their family stationed in US or NATO bases in Italy

name: Visa (Lucrative) for visitors with work permit authorization for lucrative activities
description: If you have an authorization by the National Immigration Institute (Instituto Nacional de Migración) to apply for a work-related visa; or if you are visiting Mexico to perform a professional activity and you will receive a payment in Mexico.

name: Self Employed Work Visa
description: Visa for people aged 16 or over who seek to engage in self-employed activity in Spain.

name: Employee Visa
description: Visa for people aged 16 and over who wish to work as employees in Spain (with a work contract). This visa covers seasonal work activities.

name: Non-Working (Non-Lucrative) Residency Visa
description: Visa to reside in Spain without carrying out any gainful (work or professional) activity, provided that the applicant has sufficient and guaranteed means to live on. This visa does not constitute a work permit and does not allow any type of work or professional activity, including remotely (online).

name: Residence Visa with work permit excemption
description: This visa allows the applicant to work in Spain without the need of applying previously for a work permit.

name: Family Reunification Visa
description: Visa for family members of foreigners who have legal resident status in Spain (from now on referred to as "the resident") and who wish to exercise the right to family reunification.

name: Residence visa for family members of Spanish citizens
description: Visa for family members of Spanish citizens who wish to travel to Spain for residence purposes, i.e., to stay for a period of more than 90 days.

name: Long-term residence or EU long-term residence recovery visa
description:
Long-term resident status can be recovered by foreigners who have held a long-term residence permit in Spain and who have, moreover, been absent from European Union territory for 12 consecutive months or have acquired EU long-term resident status in another EU Member State or have completed the period during which they committed not to return to Spain, having voluntarily agreed to return to their country of origin. 

EU long-term resident status can be recovered by foreigners who have held an EU long-term residence permit in Spain and who have, moreover, been absent from European Union territory for 12 consecutive months or have acquired EU long-term resident status in another EU Member State or have been out of Spain for more than 6 years.
